Title.evidence: Title: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Image Guidance Systems in Neurosurgery

Trial_Design.evidence: In this preclinical randomised study, 50 novice surgeons were allocated to one of five groups

Participants.evidence: 50 novice surgeons were allocated to one of five groups

Intervention.evidence: allocated to one of five groups: (1) no image guidance, (2) triplanar display, (3) always-on solid overlay, (4) always-on wire mesh overlay, and (5) on-demand inverse realism overlay

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of various image guidance systems against standard surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were time to task completion (seconds) and tool path length (millimeters).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 50 novice surgeons were allocated to one of five groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: Time to task completion and tool path length were significantly lower with any image guidance compared to no guidance (p < 0.001 and p = 0.003, respectively).
